revised_title: Observations of Tides and Their Relation to Moon Phases and Wind
tldr: Captain Samuel Sturmy observed tides near Bristol and found that the lowest neap tide corresponds to the highest spring tide, unless north-east winds hinder the tides. He also noted that tidal velocities are strongest at the beginning of flood and ebb and decrease gradually. Sturmy's observations differ from those at Plymouth, and he suggests comparing his findings with those from Plymouth.
